![image](https://i.ibb.co/N7WFSSj/Pics-Art-06-20-06-00-09.png)

# The New ZeroWiki

This is a clone of [[ZeroWiki]] created with better organization and information-richness in mind.
[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on [[BitTorrent]], [[Bitcoin]] and [[Tor]]. 

[[ZeroWiki]] is public and [[cloning|clonable]]. Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge by creating [[FAQ]]s and documentations, keeping track of your goals, or as simple to-do lists. See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works.

If you want to contribute to the wiki, go to the [[Contributing to this Wiki]] page for guidelines. If you don't know where to categorize a page, link to the page from the [[Uncategorized Pages]] page. You can use the [[Sandbox]] page to test out editing ZeroWiki pages.
## Topics
### [[ZeroNet]]
* [[zite|Zites]]
* [[Zite Categories]]
* [[Well-Known Developers]]
* [[ZeroNet Proxies]]
* [[ZeroNet Id Providers]]
* [[ZeroNet Releases]]
* ... [[zeronet|See More]]

### [[Internet]]
* [[World Wide Web]]
* [[Gopher Protocol]]
* [[Protocols]]
* [[Peer-to-Peer]]
* [[Decentralized]]
* ... [[internet|See More]]

### [[Cryptography]]
* [[Cryptocurrency]]
* [[Blockchain]]


### [[Programming]]

* [[Markup Languages]]
* [[Data Serialization Language]]
* ... [[programming|See More]]

### Other

* [Index](./?Index)

![image](https://i.ibb.co/N7WFSSj/Pics-Art-06-20-06-00-09.png)

= The New ZeroWiki =

This is a clone of [[ZeroWiki]] created with better organization and information-richness in mind.
[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on [[BitTorrent]], [[Bitcoin]] and [[Tor]]. 

[[ZeroWiki]] is public and [[cloning|clonable]]. Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge by creating [[FAQ]]s and documentations, keeping track of your goals, or as simple to-do lists. See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works.

If you want to contribute to the wiki, go to the [[Contributing to this Wiki]] page for guidelines. If you don't know where to categorize a page, link to the page from the [[Uncategorized Pages]] page. You can use the [[Sandbox]] page to test out editing ZeroWiki pages.

# Contributing To This Wiki

In order to make sure the navigation remains consistent, follow the below guidelines on where to link new pages:

1. Select a main, general topic -
    * These general topics are listed on the homepage. They include: [[ZeroNet]], [[Internet]], [[Cryptography]], and [[Programming]].
    * As a general rule, if something is different enough to not fall within one of these topics, then make a new topic.
    * Another general rule, if it needs to be further subdivided into categories, then *chances are* it should be a topic.
2. Categories/Groups (if applicable) -
    * These categories/groups further divide the general topics. For example, the [[ZeroNet]] topic has these subtopics: [[Zites]], [[ZeroNet Plugins]], and [[Well-Known Developers]].
    * However, not everything listed in a topic must be a category or group. You can have pages that don't have pages below it in the hierarchy.
    * If something doesn't fall within one of the current categories, create a new category.
3. If you are creating a new Category/Group or a new page within in a Category/Group, do the following:
    * Make sure you are adding the title of the page or category/group at the top using a heading (`# `).
    * Please put a vertical bar with a link to the Category/Group or Topic after the title for pages inside of a category or categories/groups.
4. Other Guidelines
    * All other heading on a page should be sub-headings, starting with `## `
    * When linking to zites, be sure to remove `http://127.0.0.1:43110` at the beginning (but retain the `/` at the start).
    * Only Topics on the homepage are allowed to put some of the subpages below them. The amount of subpages should be limited to the top 5-6 pages that would be most useful on the homepage. Be sure to add a `See More` link if more subpages exist within the topic page.
5. You can link to related pages by putting them under a `See Also` heading.

*It should be noted that currently this Wiki only deals with technology topics. In the future, I may rename topics to sub-topics and create new topics that are more general and cover other areas, like Politics, Art, etc.*
